definitions.definition: quote (a passage, book, or author) as evidence for or justification of an argument or statement, especially in a scholarly work.
examples: quote, reproduce More"cite the passage in full"refer to, make reference to, mention, allude to, adduce, instance; specify, name "the Plaintiffs have properly cited the case law in response to this motion"Morecite the passage in fullrefer to, make reference to, mention, allude to, adduce, instance; specify, name the Plaintiffs have properly cited the case law in response to this motion
medics have been cited as a key example of a modern breed of technical expert
synonyms: name "the Plaintiffs have properly cited the case law in response to this motion"

definitions.definition: praise (someone, typically a member of the armed forces) for a courageous act in an official dispatch.
examples: commend, pay tribute to, praise he has been cited many times

definitions.definition: adduce a former tried case as a guide to deciding a comparable case or in support of an argument.
summon (someone) to appear in a court of law.
examples: the summons cited four of the defendants
synonyms: subpoena "the writ cited four of the signatories"
